courses.uglyHTML:
AHA - PALS Provider ‚Äì In-Person ‚Äì Initial

The American Heart Association (AHA) Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) Provider Course is designed for healthcare professionals who manage respiratory and cardiovascular emergencies in infants and children. This instructor-led, scenario-based class emphasizes the recognition and treatment of pediatric respiratory distress, shock, and cardiac arrest.

This course is ideal for pediatricians, emergency and critical care staff, paramedics, and other providers involved in pediatric emergency response. Participants will apply AHA PALS algorithms, develop effective communication skills, and gain hands-on experience through realistic team scenarios.

üöë Course Topics Include:

  • Respiratory distress and failure recognition
  • Management of pediatric shock and cardiac arrest
  • Systematic pediatric assessment and PALS algorithms
  • Airway management techniques and related pharmacology
  • Effective team-based resuscitation and communication
  • High-quality CPR and AED use for infants and children

üìò Required Textbook:

A current AHA PALS Provider Manual is required for this course. Choose between:

  • Printed textbook: Available at registration
  • Digital eBook: Emailed upon registration

ü©∫ Add a BLS Renewal:

Need to renew BLS too? You may add the BLS Provider Renewal during registration. The skills check will be completed during your PALS session.

üìú Certification:

Upon successful completion, you will receive a 2-year American Heart Association PALS Provider eCard, valid nationwide.

Legal Attribution

PALS¬Æ and AHA¬Æ are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and are used with permission. Training is conducted in accordance with the current AHA Program Administration Manual (PAM).

courses.uglyHTML:
AHA BLS Provider ‚Äì In-Person ‚Äì Initial
Image with Floated Text Wrapping

Description

This American Heart Association (AHA) Basic Life Support (BLS) Provider course is designed for healthcare professionals who are taking BLS for the first time or whose certification has expired. It provides foundational skills needed to recognize life-threatening emergencies and respond with high-quality CPR and AED use.

Course content is delivered through instructor-led training, hands-on practice, and scenario-based instruction covering adult, child, and infant CPR.

¬†
Reference Material

We recommend reviewing the BLS Quick Reference Guide before class.

Course Details

Course Highlights:

  • High-quality CPR for adults, children, and infants
  • Use of AED and relief of choking
  • Effective team dynamics and communication
  • BLS Chain of Survival and emergency response steps

What to Expect:

This class includes video instruction, instructor guidance, and supervised practice. Instructor-to-student ratio is 1:6 during skills sessions to meet AHA training standards.

¬†

Course Length:

Approximately 3.5 to 4 hours

¬†

Certification:

American Heart Association BLS Provider eCard (valid for 2 years), issued upon successful completion of the course requirements.

¬†

AHA Disclaimer and Logo

AHA¬Æ is a registered trademark of the American Heart Association and is used with permission. 910CPR is an authorized provider aligned with an AHA Training Center.

The Heartsaver First Aid / CPR / AED program covers Adult, Child, Infant CPR with AED and Choking with various First Aid topics.
Designed for employee training in workplaces, scouting leaders, coaches, and non-medical home care workers. For employees and/or designated first responders who have a duty to respond to a first aid or cardiac emergency because of job responsibilities or regulatory requirements.
What is covered
  • Adult first aid (first aid basics, medical and injury emergencies)
  • Adult, child and infant CPR
  • Foreign-body airway obstruction
  • Use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
Includes 2-year AHA Completion Card

courses.uglyHTML:
AHA - ACLS Provider ‚Äì HeartCode¬Æ Skills Session

The ACLS HeartCode¬Æ Skills Session is the hands-on component of the American Heart Association (AHA) ACLS certification. This session is for healthcare providers who have already completed the required online HeartCode¬Æ ACLS course.

During this in-person session led by an authorized AHA Instructor, you will demonstrate your ability to apply ACLS protocols, perform high-quality CPR, and manage simulated cardiovascular emergencies.

üí° How It Works:

  • Step 1: Complete the HeartCode¬Æ ACLS online course at your convenience
  • Step 2: Schedule and attend your in-person skills session
  • Step 3: Receive your AHA ACLS Provider eCard (valid for 2 years) upon successful completion

üìå Course Highlights:

  • Instructor-led ACLS practice and skills assessment
  • Scenario-based training in airway management and cardiac emergencies
  • Team dynamics, resuscitation leadership, and rhythm recognition

üõ† Course Options:

  • Need the online ACLS course? Select the HeartCode¬Æ ACLS Course Link add-on during registration
  • Want to renew BLS too? Add a BLS Provider Renewal for a combined certification experience
  • Need both ACLS and PALS? Schedule skills sessions together after completing both online courses

üö® Important Information:

If you've already completed the online course, please bring your HeartCode¬Æ ACLS completion certificate to your scheduled session or email it to info@910cpr.com.

‚ö†Ô∏è Please note: HeartCode¬Æ ACLS course links are non-refundable.

HeartCode¬Æ and ACLS¬Æ are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and are used with permission. Training is conducted in accordance with the current AHA Program Administration Manual (PAM).

courses.uglyHTML: AHA - ACLS Provider ‚Äì In-person ‚Äì Renewal

float: right; margin: 0 0 10px 10px;" width="250"/>

This ACLS Renewal course is for experienced healthcare professionals who currently hold an active or recently expired ACLS certification. This instructor-led, scenario-based course helps reinforce and update your skills in managing cardiovascular emergencies.

Course content includes advanced clinical interventions, team dynamics, airway management, rhythm recognition, pharmacology, and post-cardiac arrest care. This format is ideal for those working in emergency departments, ICUs, and other high-acuity settings.

Course Topics Include:

  • ACLS algorithms and post-cardiac arrest care
  • Airway management and rhythm recognition
  • High-quality CPR and AED use
  • Team-based response and effective communication
  • Acute coronary syndromes and stroke management
  • Clinical decision-making in life-threatening scenarios

Course Includes:

  • Instructor-led classroom training and skills stations
  • Scenario practice and ACLS testing
  • American Heart Association ACLS Provider eCard (valid for 2 years)

Add BLS Certification:

You may add a BLS Provider Renewal to your registration to update both certifications in one session.

courses.uglyTitle:
AHA - BLS Provider - Online Class with in-Person Skill Session - Initial or Renewal
Blended Learning HeartCode¬Æ BLS
courses.cleanTitle: AHA - BLS Provider -
courses.uglyHTML:
Header Section
AHA BLS Provider ‚Äì Heartcode (Blended Learning)
Image with Floating Fix

Course Overview

The American Heart Association (AHA) Heartcode BLS course uses a blended learning format that includes an interactive online course followed by an in-person skills session. This format is ideal for healthcare professionals who need flexibility without compromising the required hands-on components of CPR training.

Centered Image

Course Description

Participants complete the online Heartcode BLS Provider course at their own pace and then attend a scheduled in-person skills session with an AHA Instructor. This allows for independent review followed by personalized feedback and evaluation of CPR skills.

Course Highlights

Course Highlights:

  • Complete the Heartcode BLS online course independently
  • Attend a 30‚Äì60 minute in-person skills session
  • Receive instructor feedback and hands-on practice
  • Demonstrate proficiency in high-quality CPR and AED use
  • Earn a two-year AHA BLS Provider eCard upon successful completion
Course Options

Course Options:

  • Heartcode BLS Access Code: Must be completed prior to the skills session. Course available at shopcpr.heart.org.
  • Add-on Option: Heartsaver First Aid skills testing available during your appointment. Great for students or workplaces that require both CPR and First Aid certification.
Important Note

Important:
Please email your AHA Heartcode BLS completion certificate to info@910cpr.com or bring a printed copy to your skills session. Completion is required for participation and eCard issuance.

Non-Refundable Notice

** The AHA Heartcode course link is non-refundable once issued. **

Cancellation and Refund Policy

Cancellation Policy:
You may reschedule your in-person session once with 48-hour notice. The AHA BLS Provider eCard is issued the same day as successful skills completion.

CME Credit Information

Continuing Medical Education (CME) Credits:
The American Heart Association (AHA) authorizes the use of their courses for continuing education credits. The number of credit hours depends on the class and accrediting agency.

Accrediting Agencies:
- American Medical Association (AMA): 1 credit = 1 hour.
- American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC): 1 credit = 1 hour.
- CAPCE: 1 credit = 1 hour.

Credit Hours for AHA Courses:
- BLS Online: 0.25 credit per hour
- ACLS / PALS Online: 0.5 credit per hour
- In-person skills sessions may not be credit-eligible depending on your agency

AHA Logo and Trademark

AHA¬Æ is a registered trademark of the American Heart Association and is used with permission. 910CPR is an authorized provider aligned with an AHA Training Center.

courses.uglyHTML:
AHA - ACLS Provider ‚Äì In-person

The Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) course is designed for healthcare professionals involved in the management of cardiopulmonary emergencies and resuscitation. This in-person, instructor-led training follows American Heart Association guidelines and emphasizes high-performance team dynamics and clinical decision-making in critical situations.

This course is intended for personnel in emergency response, emergency medicine, intensive care, and critical care units. You may add an optional BLS renewal during registration if both certifications are needed.

Course Topics Include:

  • Early recognition and management of respiratory and cardiac arrest
  • Airway management and related pharmacology
  • Post-cardiac arrest care and team communication
  • Identification and treatment of acute coronary syndromes and stroke

Course Includes:

  • Instructor-led classroom training with video-based and scenario-driven instruction
  • Hands-on station practice and skills testing
  • American Heart Association ACLS Provider eCard (valid for 2 years)

AHA¬Æ and ACLS¬Æ are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and are used with permission. Training is conducted in accordance with the current AHA Program Administration Manual (PAM).

courses.cleanTitle: ARC - BLS -
courses.uglyHTML:
ARC - Basic Life Support (Blended Learning | Skills Session)
Complete your ARC BLS certification with online coursework and an in-person skills check.

Train on your schedule with American Red Cross Blended Learning. This ARC Basic Life Support (BLS) Course combines self-paced online learning with a hands-on skills check led by an ARC-certified instructor. Once you complete the online course and test, bring your Certificate of Completion to your scheduled in-person session.

‚ÄúYour certification, your way‚Äîengaging, efficient, and tailored to your needs.‚Äù Blended learning lets you complete coursework at your own pace before testing your hands-on skills in a supportive, instructor-led setting.

üìå How It Works:

  • Step 1: Receive a link to the ARC BLS online course and complete the coursework and test.
  • Step 2: Schedule and attend an in-person ARC Skills Check with an instructor.
  • Step 3: Upon passing, receive your 2-year ARC BLS digital certificate, accessible anytime.

üéØ Who Should Take This Course?

  • Healthcare professionals needing ARC BLS certification
  • Medical and dental office staff, home healthcare workers
  • Anyone needing BLS training for work or school

üìú Certification:

Upon successful completion, participants will receive a 2-year Basic Life Support digital certificate with anytime, anywhere access to training records.

‚ÄúWe respect your time and experience‚ÄîCPR training that adapts to you.‚Äù Our blended learning model ensures efficient training that fits your schedule while providing expert hands-on instruction when you need it.

ARC - BLS - In-Person Classroom

courses.cleanTitle:
ARC - BLS - In-Person Classroom
Instructor-led Classroom for Expired or New BLS
courses.uglyHTML:
Header Section
American Red Cross - Basic Life Support (BLS)
Image with Floating Fix (Prevents Sidebar Issues)

Course Overview

The American Red Cross Basic Life Support (BLS) Provider course is designed for healthcare professionals and first responders who need to develop or refresh their life-saving skills in a structured, hands-on environment.

This instructor-led course delivers high-performance CPR training with a strong focus on team-based response, real-world scenarios, and hands-on skill practice. It meets industry standards for emergency care training and ensures participants gain the confidence needed to respond quickly and effectively to cardiac and breathing emergencies.

Ensure Container Doesn't Collapse
¬†
Course Topics

Course Topics Include:

  • High-quality CPR techniques for adults, children, and infants
  • Proper use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
  • Airway management and ventilation techniques
  • Team-based resuscitation skills and communication strategies
  • Opioid overdose emergency response
  • Legal and ethical considerations in emergency care
Course Includes

Course Includes:

  • Instructor-led training with hands-on skills practice
  • Digital American Red Cross BLS Provider Certificate (Valid for 2 Years)
  • Engaging team-based learning scenarios

courses.uglyHTML:
AHA - PALS Provider ‚Äì In-Person ‚Äì Renewal

The American Heart Association (AHA) Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) Provider Renewal Course is designed for healthcare professionals who currently hold a current or recently expired AHA PALS Provider card. This in-person, instructor-led course reinforces core pediatric emergency care skills through scenario-based instruction and hands-on practice.

Participants will refine pediatric assessment strategies, strengthen clinical decision-making skills, and demonstrate team-based resuscitation techniques using the AHA PALS algorithm. This course is ideal for providers working in emergency departments, intensive care, or other high-acuity environments.

üöë Course Topics Include:

  • PALS algorithms and systematic pediatric assessment
  • Management of respiratory distress and failure
  • Recognition and treatment of pediatric shock and cardiac arrest
  • Airway management and pharmacology in pediatric emergencies
  • Team dynamics and effective communication during resuscitation
  • High-quality CPR and AED use for infants and children

üìò Required Textbook:

The current AHA PALS Provider Manual is required for this course. Choose one at registration:

  • Printed manual: Available for shipping or pickup
  • Digital eBook: Delivered via email for instant access

ü©∫ Add a BLS Renewal:

Need to renew both certifications? Add the BLS Provider Renewal option during registration and complete both on the same day.

üìú Certification:

Upon successful completion, you will receive a 2-year American Heart Association PALS Provider eCard, issued the same day and valid nationwide.

Legal Attribution

PALS¬Æ and AHA¬Æ are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and used with permission. Training is conducted in accordance with the current Program Administration Manual (PAM).

courses.uglyTitle: AHA - Family & Friends¬Æ CPR
courses.cleanTitle: AHA - Family & Friends¬Æ CPR
courses.uglyHTML:
¬†
The Family & Friends CPR course is intended for anyone who wants to learn CPR and prefers to learn in¬†
an Instructor-led or facilitated group environment. This course is for people who do not need a course completion card for a job or other¬†requirements.
The course is ideal for parents, grandparents, caregivers, school groups and students, and others interested in learning how to save a life. Skills are taught using American Heart Association's research-proven practice-while-watching technique, which allows participants to practice on a CPR training manikin while skills are demonstrated in the course video.
¬†

Course Content

  • Adult Hands-Only CPR and AED
  • Adult CPR With Breaths
  • Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Adult¬†
  • Child CPR and AED¬†
  • Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Child¬†
  • Infant CPR
  • Mild and Severe Airway Block: How to Help a Choking Infant
¬†
¬†
NOTE: This AHA Friends and Family program is not a CERTIFICATION course.¬† ¬†If you need to be certified for work or school, please view these programs:¬†
  • BLS Provider¬†for the healthcare professional:
    • HeartCode -¬†Online class with in-person skills; or,
    • BLS¬†- In-person class and testing
  • HeartSaver for individuals with limited or no medical training that are required to have First Aid and/or CPR/AED to meet regulatory reasons.
    • HeartCode¬†-¬†Online class with in-person skills;¬†or,
    • HeartSaver¬†-¬†In-person class and testing
      • CPR/AED only,
      • First Aid, CPR/AED.
¬†

courses.uglyTitle:
Elementary First Aid
to meet "U.S. Coast Guard Maritime Elementary First Aid and CPR" Requirement
courses.cleanTitle:
Elementary First Aid
to meet "U.S. Coast Guard Maritime Elementary First Aid and CPR" Requirement
courses.uglyHTML:
üí≥ Same-day certification includes both AHA eCard and AMERHA-216 form

The American Heart Association‚Äôs Heartsaver¬Æ First Aid CPR AED (TOTAL) course is officially recognized by the U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) as meeting the full training requirement for Elementary First Aid.

This instructor-led course includes hands-on training in adult first aid, CPR, AED use, and choking relief, and is ideal for mariners, maritime professionals, and others seeking credentials that meet USCG standards.

This program meets:

  • STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid
  • 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3)
  • 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1) ‚Äì First Aid & CPR training requirements

Course ID: AMERHA-216

Certification: AHA Heartsaver¬Æ eCard (valid for 2 years) and signed USCG form AMERHA-216 provided same day

Duration: ~2.5 to 3.5 hours depending on group size and skill level

This training is delivered in accordance with the AHA PAM and has been reviewed and accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center (NMC).

courses.uglyTitle: American Heart Association
courses.cleanTitle: American Heart Association's Online Heartsaver¬Æ Programs
courses.uglyHTML:
The Dates/Times below are for a Hands-On Session (Step 2) for an AHA online course.

* If you need Step 1: Once you choose a date to test, you will be offered Class Type selections. (e.g., First Aid CPR/AED, Pediatric First Aid CPR, etc.)

If you are seeking a Merchant Mariner First Aid Certification, add both TOTAL and the AMERHA-216 options.

Bloodborne Pathogens can be added to any selection.

The Heartsaver Online courses are taught in a blended learning format. Students must complete the online portion, followed by the hands-on skills session conducted by an American Heart Association Training Center Instructor. Upon successful completion, students will receive a Heartsaver Course Completion Card, valid for 2 years.

The AHA‚Äôs Heartsaver courses are designed for individuals with little or no medical training who require first aid and/or CPR training for job requirements, regulatory compliance (OSHA), or personal preparedness.

Table for Course Options
The AHA's Heartsaver Online Courses Are Available in the Following Options:
First Aid with CPR/AED TOTAL
( Click for course details)		 Comprehensive course designed to meet OSHA and other regulatory requirements. Includes all available course topics. Meets US Coast Guard Elementary First Aid training requirements.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1.25 to 3 hours.
First Aid with CPR/AED BASIC
( Click for course details)		 Flexible course with optional topics.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1.25 to 3 hours.
Pediatric First Aid and CPR/AED Focuses on infants and children (adult training is optional). Ideal for childcare workers, teachers, and camp counselors.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1.5 to 3 hours.
CPR/AED Only Teaches how to perform CPR and use an AED safely and effectively.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1 to 1.5 hours.
First Aid Only For individuals needing a First Aid completion card to meet job, regulatory, or other requirements.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1.5 hours.
Bloodborne Pathogens Designed for workers likely to encounter bloodborne pathogens, including healthcare workers, security personnel, and tattoo artists.
Estimated Online Course Time: 1 hour.
This course can be completed 100% online.

Upon completion of the online portion, bring your Certificate of Completion to class or email it to info@910cpr.com.

courses.uglyTitle:
AHA - BLS Provider - In-person Renewal
Instructor-led Classroom program for BLS Renewal
courses.cleanTitle:
AHA - BLS Provider - In-person Renewal
Instructor-led Classroom program for BLS Renewal
courses.uglyHTML:
Header
AHA BLS Provider ‚Äì In-Person ‚Äì Renewal
Image with Floated Text Wrapping

Course Description

This American Heart Association (AHA) Basic Life Support (BLS) Renewal course is designed for healthcare professionals with a current, valid AHA BLS Provider card who are seeking recertification. This course provides a focused review of core CPR and AED skills and allows participants to demonstrate continued competency in high-quality CPR.

Prerequisite

Requirement: You must bring a current, valid AHA BLS Provider card to class. If your card is expired, please contact us prior to registration to verify eligibility.

Ensure Container Doesn't Collapse
¬†
Course Style

This instructor-led, classroom-based course includes video instruction, skills demonstration, and scenario-based practice. Instructor-to-student ratio is maintained at 1:6 during hands-on sessions to meet AHA standards.

Quick Reference

We recommend reviewing the BLS Quick Reference Guide prior to class.

Course Highlights

Course Highlights:

  • High-quality CPR for adults, children, and infants
  • Use of AED and relief of choking
  • Effective team dynamics and communication
  • Opioid emergencies and maternity considerations
  • Hands-on practice with BVM, pocket mask, and two-rescuer CPR
Course Length

Course Length:

Approximately 3 hours (minimum per AHA PAM for BLS Renewal)

Certification

Certification:

American Heart Association BLS Provider eCard (valid for 2 years), issued upon successful completion of all course components.

CME Info - Retained

Continuing Medical Education (CME) Credits:
The American Heart Association (AHA) authorizes the use of their courses for continuing education credits. The number of credit hours depends on the class and the accrediting agency.

Accrediting Agencies:
- American Medical Association (AMA): 1 credit = 1 hour.
- American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC): 1 credit = 1 hour.
- Commission on Accreditation for Pre-Hospital Continuing Education (CAPCE): 1 credit = 1 hour.

Credit Hours for AHA Courses:
- BLS Online: 0.25 credits per hour.
- ACLS / PALS Online: 0.5 credits per hour.
- In-Person Courses: Typically do not offer CME credits, except for specific regional requirements.

For more detailed information about how to claim your CME credits, refer to the official AHA guidelines or contact your licensing agency for specific requirements.

AHA Disclaimer and Logo

AHA¬Æ is a registered trademark of the American Heart Association and is used with permission. 910CPR is an authorized provider aligned with an AHA Training Center.

Inline JavaScript for Expandable Section

courses.uglyHTML:
** Same-day certification ‚Äî AHA Heartsaver¬Æ eCard + AMERHA-216 **

Complete the coursework online at your own pace
Then select your preferred date below for the required in-person skills check

This blended learning option allows you to complete the American Heart Association‚Äôs Heartsaver¬Æ First Aid CPR AED course online, followed by a brief hands-on skills session with a certified instructor. You‚Äôll receive your AHA eCard and USCG-approved documentation on the same day.

The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) has approved this course as meeting the following Elementary First Aid requirements:
  • STCW Code Table A-VI/1-3: Elementary First Aid
  • 46 CFR 11.302(a)(3) and 12.602(a)(3)
  • 46 CFR 11.201(i)(1): First Aid and CPR training for mariner credentialing

Course Includes: Adult First Aid, CPR, AED use, and choking relief (AHA Heartsaver¬Æ Total content)

Course ID: AMERHA-216

Certification: AHA eCard (valid for 2 years) + AMERHA-216 USCG form ‚Äî both issued same day

Heartsaver¬Æ and AHA¬Æ are registered trademarks of the American Heart Association and are used with permission. This course is delivered in accordance with the AHA‚Äôs Program Administration Manual (PAM) and meets the requirements outlined by the U.S. Coast Guard National Maritime Center.

courses.uglyHTML:
The Adult and Pediatric First Aid/CPR/AED course incorporates the latest science and teaches students to recognize and care for a variety of first aid emergencies such as burns, cuts, scrapes, sudden illnesses, head, neck, back injuries, heat and cold emergencies and how to respond to breathing and cardiac emergencies to help victims of any age - adults (about 12 years and older) and pediatric (infants and children up to 12 years of age).¬†Students who successfully complete this course will receive a certificate for Adult and Pediatric First Aid/CPR/AED valid for two years.

Includes: 2-year ARC Certification Card

¬†

HSI Adult First Aid | Adult/Child/Infant CPR AED - Blended Learning

The HSI Adult First Aid | Adult/Child/Infant CPR AED course is a comprehensive blended learning program combining online instruction with an in-person, instructor-led skills session. This format allows for flexible self-paced online learning¬†while ensuring hands-on practice with essential life-saving techniques.

üìå Course Highlights:

  • Blended Learning: Complete engaging online modules covering first aid, CPR, and AED use, followed by an in-person skills session.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: Learn to respond effectively to emergencies involving adults, children, and infants, including choking, cardiac arrest, and trauma
  • Up-to-Date Content: Follows the latest ILCOR & AHA 2020 Guidelines¬†for CPR & Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC).

ü©∫ Who Should Enroll?

This course is perfect for non-healthcare professionals¬†who require or desire CPR and first aid training, including:

  • Emergency response teams in workplaces
  • Fitness trainers and health club staff
  • Adult residential caregivers
  • Teachers, coaches, and childcare providers
  • Anyone interested in gaining essential first aid & CPR skills

üéì Course Components:

  • In-Person Skills Session: Attend an instructor-led session for hands-on practice and evaluation.

üìú Certification:

Upon successful completion of the online and in-person components, participants will receive a 2-year HSI First Aid | CPR AED certification.

¬†

Gain the confidence and knowledge to respond effectively in emergency situations¬†and make a difference in your community!

courses.uglyHTML:
HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED - In-Person Training

The HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED course is a nationally recognized, instructor-led program that teaches essential skills for responding to medical emergencies involving adults, children, and infants. Participants will learn how to provide high-quality CPR, use an AED, and offer effective first aid in real-world situations‚Äîfrom workplace incidents to home-based emergencies.

üìå Course Highlights:

  • Comprehensive Curriculum: Includes CPR, AED use, choking relief, bleeding control, burns, shock, and more.
  • Evidence-Based Training: Follows the latest ILCOR resuscitation science and the 2020 AHA Guidelines for CPR and ECC.

ü©∫ Who Should Enroll?

This course is ideal for non-healthcare professionals and workplace responders, including:

  • Emergency response teams
  • Teachers, coaches, and childcare staff
  • Adult residential caregivers
  • Fitness instructors and health club personnel
  • General public looking to be better prepared for emergencies

üõ•Ô∏è Also Approved for Maritime Personnel:

For individuals seeking a Merchant Mariner Credential, this course meets the USCG Elementary First Aid and CPR requirement under 46 CFR 11.201. Successful maritime students will receive:

  • A 2-year HSI Adult First Aid | CPR AED certification card
  • A HSINST-203 Recognition of Participation document accepted by the United States Coast Guard

This approval is granted by the USCG National Maritime Center and ensures compliance for those pursuing or renewing USCG licenses.

üéì Course Format:

  • In-Person, Instructor-Led: Includes hands-on skill sessions and guided practice with certified instructors.

üèÜ National Recognitions:

  • OSHA Compliant: Meets workplace safety training requirements
  • USCG Accepted: Approved under course code HSINST-203
  • FAA, ACA, NREMT Approved: Recognized by aviation, EMS, and camp staff organizations

Whether you're in the classroom, the workplace, or the wheelhouse of a boat‚Äîthis course delivers the hands-on confidence and certification you need to respond when it matters most.

courses.uglyHTML:
Header Section
üö® BLS Challenge ‚Äì Assessment-Only Option for Experienced Providers
Course Overview

¬†

This is an assessment-only session‚Äîan American Red Cross BLS Challenge‚Äîdesigned for experienced providers who need to renew their certification. There is no instruction or remediation during this session.

¬†

Important Notes

üî• IMPORTANT:

  • You must demonstrate all BLS skills and pass a written test to earn certification.
  • This is not a training course. You must already know the skills like the back of your hand.
  • If you fail the Challenge, you will not be certified and must complete the full BLS course at a later date.
Preparation Note

üí° We strongly recommend that you purchase the ARC BLS Provider Manual (or use reliable online resources) to review and practice before attempting the Challenge. There are also non-endorsed YouTube videos that can help‚Äîsearch for "ARC BLS skills demonstration" for reference.

¬†

Refund Policy

‚ö†Ô∏è No refunds for Challenge failures.

¬†

Confidence Statement

Confidence is key. Know it, show it, and get certified!

courses.uglyTitle:
HSI BLS and Adult First Aid | Blended Learning
Online Coursework with In-Person Skills Testing
courses.cleanTitle: HSI BLS and Adult First Aid |
courses.uglyHTML:
Header Section
HSI BLS and Adult First Aid ‚Äì Blended Learning
Image with Floating Fix

Course Overview

This HSI blended learning course combines Basic Life Support (BLS) and Adult First Aid/CPR/AED into a single certification. It's perfect for workplaces that need both credentials to meet insurance or licensing requirements. Participants complete an online course and then attend a brief in-person skills session with an authorized HSI instructor.

¬†

Centered Image

¬†

Course Description

Once registered, students receive a link to the online portion, which covers adult CPR, AED use, First Aid basics, and professional-level BLS topics such as team response, airway support, and high-performance compressions. After completing the online section, students attend a short in-person session to demonstrate hands-on skills and receive real-time feedback.

Course Highlights

Course Highlights:

  • One card covers both Adult First Aid and BLS
  • Ideal for professional offices, medical/dental staff, and facilities requiring dual compliance
  • Complete the online course at your own pace
  • Attend a 30‚Äì60 minute in-person skills session
  • Earn a two-year HSI certification upon successful completion
Real-World Relevance

This little-known 'combo' class was¬†hiding in plain sight‚Äî but, it was exactly what a local ABA center needed and didn‚Äôt know existed. They were facing a $120+ per person AHA combo (Heartcode BLS + Heartsaver First Aid + skills session) just to meet TRICARE and TRILLIUM requirements. We helped them uncover this streamlined HSI alternative ‚Äî and now it‚Äôs available for others in the same spot.

¬†

Course Options:

  • HSI Blended Course Link: Provided after registration. Must be completed prior to your scheduled skills session.
  • Group Option: Onsite training and flexible scheduling available for businesses or organizations with 5 or more participants.

Important Note

Important:
Please complete the HSI online course before attending your scheduled skills session. You will need to show proof of completion at the time of your appointment.

Non-Refundable Notice

** The HSI blended course link is non-refundable once issued. **

Cancellation and Refund Policy

Cancellation Policy:
You may reschedule your in-person session once with 48-hour notice. Your HSI certification is issued the same day as successful skills completion.

¬†

Continuing Education Credit:
Many HSI courses are eligible for CE credit through employer, EMS, or nursing boards. Contact your licensing authority for eligibility confirmation. HSI provides a downloadable completion record for documentation.

HSI Logo and Trademark

HSI¬Æ is a registered trademark of Health & Safety Institute. 910CPR is an authorized provider offering blended learning and in-person HSI courses.

HSI Pediatric First Aid | CPR AED ‚Äî Blended Online + In-Person Skills
‚úî Fulfills the CPR/First Aid component of NC DCDEE (10A NCAC 09 .1102); additional NC trainings required for full compliance
‚úî Fulfills the CPR/First Aid requirement in CT OEC (Sec. 19a-79-4a); center policies/modules may apply
courses.uglyHTML:
DESCRIPTION (robust, SEO-friendly)

üß∏ HSI Pediatric First Aid | CPR AED (Blended)

Be prepared. Stay calm. Take action. This nationally recognized HSI Pediatric First Aid | CPR AED ‚Äì Blended (Guidelines 2020) course gives childcare professionals and families the skills to respond quickly to infant, child, and adult emergencies. The blended format combines convenient online learning with a brief, hands-on in-person skills session for real-world confidence and compliance.

  • üñ•Ô∏è Part 1 ‚Äì Online: Interactive modules you can complete on your schedule (mobile/desktop friendly)
  • üè• Part 2 ‚Äì Skills: Short, instructor-led practice and skills verification with manikins and AED trainer
  • ‚úÖ 2-year HSI certification upon successful completion
  • üíº Ideal for licensed childcare, preschools, daycares, after-school programs, camps, babysitters, nannies, foster/adoptive parents, and youth-program staff

üìö What You‚Äôll Learn

  • ü§í Medical emergencies: asthma, difficulty breathing, seizures, diabetic issues, severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis)
  • ü©π Injury care: bleeding control, bandaging, burns, sprains/strains, fractures, head/neck/spine precautions
  • üòÆ‚Äçüí® Choking relief techniques for infants, children, and adults
  • üíì High-quality CPR (infant/child/adult) and safe AED operation
  • üåä Drowning and near-drowning response; post-rescue care
  • üêç Bites, stings, and environmental exposures (heat/cold, poison)
  • üß† Prevention spotlight: Shaken Baby Syndrome/Abusive Head Trauma

üìù Compliance at a Glance (NC DCDEE 10A NCAC 09 .1102)

This course fulfills the CPR/First Aid certification piece and teaches several emergency topics child-care staff need. For full .1102 compliance, add the NC-approved trainings and your center‚Äôs written policies listed below.

  • ‚úì Pediatric CPR & First Aid (infant/child)
  • ‚úì Prevention/response to food allergies & anaphylaxis
  • ‚úì Shaken Baby Syndrome / Abusive Head Trauma (prevention)
  • ‚ñ° Infectious-disease control & immunization program policies
  • ‚ñ° Medication administration & parental-consent standards
  • ‚ñ° Building/premises safety (electrical, water, traffic hazards)
  • ‚ñ° Emergency Preparedness & Response (written EPR plan + training)
  • ‚ñ° Hazardous-materials handling & biocontaminant disposal
  • ‚ñ° Child transportation precautions
  • ‚ñ° Recognizing/reporting child abuse, neglect, maltreatment
  • ‚ñ° SIDS prevention & safe sleep (ITS-SIDS)

Finish the checklist: NC requires ITS-SIDS Safe Sleep, Emergency Preparedness & Response (EPR), Medication Administration, and Recognizing/Reporting Child Maltreatment trainings, plus your center‚Äôs written policies for premises safety, hazards/biowaste, transportation, and immunizations.

üåé Service Area & Options

Public classes and on-site group training are available across Southeastern North Carolina (Wilmington, Burgaw, Jacksonville, surrounding counties). Blended delivery keeps downtime low while ensuring hands-on practice and evaluation.

üí° Why 910CPR for HSI Pediatric Training?

  • Fast, flexible scheduling for skills sessions
  • Clear, practical instruction focused on real childcare scenarios
  • Digital certification and completion record for your files
  • Group/onsite pricing available for centers and schools
Tiny resource links (full URLs shown)

NC rulebook (.1102): https://ncchildcare.ncdhhs.gov/Portals/0/documents/pdf/D/DCDEE_Rulebook.pdf ¬†|¬† NC EPR info: https://ncchildcare.ncdhhs.gov/Provider/Emergency-Preparedness-and-Response ¬†|¬† ITS-SIDS: https://ncchildcare.ncdhhs.gov/Provider/Training-and-Professional-Development/ITS-SIDS-Project

courses.uglyTitle: AHA - Heartsaver¬Æ CPR AED (No First Aid) - In-person üöí
courses.cleanTitle: AHA - Heartsaver¬Æ CPR AED (No First Aid) - In-person üöí
courses.uglyHTML:
AHA Heartsaver¬Æ CPR AED (No First Aid)

This CPR/AED-only class teaches how to recognize cardiac arrest, give high-quality chest compressions, use an AED, and relieve choking in adults (with optional child/infant modules as needed). No First Aid topics are included.

Special note: üéâ Free for the community! If you need an official AHA certification card for work or volunteer roles, you can choose to purchase the AHA Heartsaver CPR AED eCard during registration (issued upon successful completion).

Who it‚Äôs good for / who typically needs this

  • üè¢ Workplace teams (office, retail, hospitality, manufacturing)
  • üè´ School staff, teachers, bus drivers, campus personnel
  • üèÄ Coaches, gym/fitness staff, lifeguards (when CPR/AED only is required)
  • üë∂ Childcare providers, babysitters, foster/adoptive families (when First Aid isn‚Äôt required)
  • üôè Ushers/volunteers at churches & community organizations
  • üëµ Caregivers for family members at home
  • üß∞ Construction/trades crews whose employer or site policy specifies CPR/AED
  • üßë‚Äçüíº General employees designated as on-site responders by company policy
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Not for hospital/clinical providers‚Äîchoose BLS for Healthcare Providers instead

What you‚Äôll learn

  • ü´Ä Adult CPR: high-quality compressions, rescue breaths, and teamwork
  • üßíüë∂ Child & Infant CPR modules
  • ‚ö° AED operation: power-on, pad placement, safety, and shock delivery
  • üÜò Choking relief for adults (optional child/infant choking if selected)
  • ‚õëÔ∏è Recognizing cardiac arrest & activating EMS (scene safety, 9-1-1)
  • üß¥ Barrier devices & hygiene considerations during CPR

Certification & format

  • ‚úÖ AHA Heartsaver¬Æ CPR AED eCard (optional purchase during registration)
  • üóìÔ∏è Valid for 2 years (upon successful completion)
  • üë• Instructor-led, hands-on practice with skills testing
  • üíô Community attendance and participation encouraged at no cost
